commands.name: az communication email create
commands.summary: Create a new EmailService or update an existing EmailService.
commands.syntax:
az communication email create --data-location
                              --email-service-name
                              --resource-group
                              [--location]
                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--tags]
examples: az communication email create -n ResourceName -g ResourceGroup --location global --data-location unitedstates --tags "{tag:tag}"

commands.name: az communication email delete
commands.syntax:
az communication email delete [--email-service-name]
                              [--ids]
                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--resource-group]
                              [--subscription]
                              [--yes]
examples: az communication email delete -n ResourceName -g ResourceGroup

commands.name: az communication email list
commands.summary: List requests to list all resources in a subscription.

commands.name: az communication email send
commands.summary: Send an email and get final status.
commands.syntax:
az communication email send --sender
                            --subject
                            [--attachment-types]
                            [--attachments]
                            [--bcc]
                            [--cc]
                            [--connection-string]
                            [--disable-tracking {false, true}]
                            [--html]
                            [--importance {high, low, normal}]
                            [--inline-attachments]
                            [--reply-to]
                            [--text]
                            [--to]
                            [--wait-until {0, 1, completed, started}]
examples: az communication email send --sender "NoReply@contoso.com" --subject "Contoso Update" --to "user1@user1-domain.com" "user2@user2-domain.com" --text "Hello valued client. There is an update."

commands.name: az communication email show
commands.summary: Get the EmailService and its properties.
examples: az communication email show -n ResourceName -g ResourceGroup

commands.name: az communication email update
commands.summary: Update a new EmailService or update an existing EmailService.
commands.syntax:
az communication email update [--add]
                              [--email-service-name]
                              [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--ids]
                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                              [--remove]
                              [--resource-group]
                              [--set]
                              [--subscription]
                              [--tags]
examples: az communication email update -n ResourceName -g ResourceGroup --tags "{tag:tag}"

commands.name: az communication email wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
